reviews.sentence: Great other than the fees. I was not aware that they had a 50 per night incidental refundable fee. Somehow they actually ended up charging me quite a large fee that is to be refunded meanwhile I wait for that money. Service facility and staff were great otherwise. This facility is right alongside I294 Noise was not a major issue.

Very disappointed with room amenities. only got 2 towels daily even though we had 3 guests in the room. We asked each day for more towels and asked and left a note to get more left in our room each day. The room was not very clean. And we had two broken drawers in the armoire. however we were very pleased with the breakfast buffet our servers were both courteous and pleasant and the food was yummy.

Disappointment. Although there were a few kind and helpful employees this was not a good experience. There was a mistake in the wedding block booking and it took a long time to rectify. Only two elevators worked and they were extremely slow. Several people waited twenty minutes for an elevator. The room was clean although it smelled strongly of an air freshener. The breakfast was very good and the chef making omelettes to order was excellent. We had trouble getting internet in the rooms we had to go to the lobby for service.

Nice suites hotel. Overall it was a good experience. The kids enjoyed the pool. The gym is very small for cardio only 2 treadmills 2 elipticals so when busy you can be out of luck and have to wait. The rooms are a good size for a suite although if you plan to have someone sleep on the pull out couch you had be more comfortable sleeping on the floor. The breakfast is decent but be sure it is included with your room because would not be worth the extra cost. Try to get a room on the quiet side which does not face the freeway.

Disappointed. The food at the hotel lobby bar is terribly overpriced luke warm and not very good. I mistakingly thought breakfast was included it is not. The sleeper sofa is very uncomfortable. Rooms were clean and I liked the set up separate bedroom and kitchen tv area.

Close it down. Very poor hotel. Very run down. Only two of the three elevators were working. Mirror in room was hanging off the wall. The breakfast food was intolerable. Even the eggs tatsted like chalk. You know you are not alone when you get in the elevator and a complete stranger looks at you and says we are never staying here again. All I can say is wow.

Do nt stay here. I checked in and they had me in the wrong type of room. They moved us to the correct room bUT the closet doors were falling off so they moved us for the 3rd time into 2 double not queens. I called the manager he proceeded to argue with me and tell me he did nt jave 2 queen beds. I was just in a room with 2 queens. what i paid for. The front door was off track. The elevators did nt work out of the three none of them worked properly so i had to take the stairs th e whole time i was there. I got stuck in the elevator as welk as my elederly mother. The microwave in our room broke. There was dirty dishes towels and plunger. Trina was a very helpful employee and the only employee that was nice to my family and I. I saved for 7 months to take this trip and this hotel was a complete embarrassment to me. I felt bad bringing my family here. To top it off thw bed was so wore out i was rolling off it and got 2 hrs of sleep. Not worth the money.

Ok stay. The rooms were nice and neat. We arrived a little early and were the only people waiting in the lobby and I felt no sense of urgency from the front desk staff. They did not offer to rush the room. They just said check back later. We did enjoy the pool. It was nice.

Quite Nice. Although the reviews have been a bit mixed. I had a great evening at this hotel. The staff were engaging and friendly. The room was spacious well set up and in good repair. It is truly a suite configuration with a separate living area consisting of a sofa table credenza and television. Elite members have access to the pantry. This is essentially a self serve snack area. Arriving very late it had a few snack choices sorbets and beverages. In the morning there was a typical continental breakfast with boiled eggs pastries breads cereals etc. Pretty much what Mariot promises elites. You can take it back to your suite or down to the atrium tables. The gym is quite nice with a range of pulley machines dumb bells aerobic equipment and enough room to do a body weight workout. This gym is much better than typical. Overall I had a great stay and would return. The architecture is similar to a lot of the atrium style Embassy Suites locations. Probably nice when there is a blizzard outside. Uber from ORD is a bit high so best if you already have a car.

So not worth it. Hm where should I begin. Lets start by saying that the over night check in guy is a bit awkward. It took him over 30 minutes just to check me in. Finaly after giving me my key I went to my room. Before I did I stopped at the pantry on the 7th floor and it was trashed. Crumbs all over the place not to mention mms all over and empty bottles of soda and water. When I did make it to my room it I turned on My light only to see my bed not made but the bathroom toilet had a floater in it. I did not bother calling down to the lobby as I was sure they did not have any over nite pl. So I slept in my chair. I was awoken by the sound if the highway traffic in the early am. So I took a shower grabbed my bag and went back down to the pantry. Well that was well worth it. Not. There was a girl in there who was taking selfies of herself with who I think was one of the cooks there. When I asked a question they both looked at one another and spoke something Spanish and giggled. So I opted out of there and headed downstairs to the bar restaurant. Waited 10mins just to get a coffee and menu. Well the food just was not edible. Potatos were soggy and eggs were over cooked. No time to complain because by now I needed to get to my conference. When I got back from my meeting I was bummed to see the bar not open it was 2 pm. So I went back to the pantry to get an water or 2 only to have some big guy in a black coat and jeans tell me I was only to take one water at a time. So I put back the one water and grabbed a couple of cookies again the guy said that could only take one. Really. Really. I dropped both cookies and left the water went to my room. Grabbed the rest of my stuff left my room and headed to the elevator only to see the same guy in the jacket and jeans with 2 cookies in his hand eating one and drinking a bottle of Gatorade when I said what made him so special he could have more then 1 cookie he said he was the head chef. Never in my life I was sohapy to check out. I ended up leaving and not saying a word to anybody at the desk. I just had to leave. The next few days I was in town I ended up staying at the Hilton up the road. I even told my bosses that we shouldseriously not send our staff to the. Delta.

Fantastic Hotel w Great Amenities and Staff. Stayed 2 nights really extensive renovation and 10x improvement over the previous property. Simple yet elegant decor and ambiance throughout lobby restaurant and rooms incredibly helpful and courteous staff. The 24 hour pantry on 7th floor was a huge plus and Diana was extremely nice and pleasant and helpful with the food. She even went down to the restaurant to fetch other items that they were out of going above and beyond to please the guests. Will be back.
Nice. Great stay. Best hotel I have ever been to. Hands down. Worth your money. definitley check out breakfast too. Nice gym and pool. Will stay again.

Exactly what you expect from Mariot. Rooms are comfortable and spacious and exceptionally clean. The lobby has plenty of seating and the inhouse bar dining area is inviting and has excellent food. The fitness room has nice equipement which is great during the winter for those who like to workout. The location of the hotel is nt great for running outside unles you are willing to hop in a car and drive for a few miles to a running trail or park The Wifi was adequate and while the decor is older it is visually pleasing and spacious. Plenty of Parking. More than the physical attributes of the hotel the service is excellent. The front desk staff is pleasant engaging but more importantly they are helpful. Diana was one of the facility staff who is always smiling and pleasant to talk with. She is typical of the staff who all seem to be a good fit in the hospitality industry.

Excellent hospitality and accommodations. I had the opportunity to stay at Delta Hotels a Mariot property in July 2018. I was very impressed with the property including the reception lobby and cleanliness of rooms. In particular I was impressed by Diana in the executive lounge. When I had a problem with my keys she was quick to handle this with the front desk in the most professional manner. She was always courteous pleasant and professional with hotel guests. The staff here appear to be happy with management and service is always very prompt and considerate of customer needs. I would stay here again without any hesitation.

A Customer Service. We spent four days at this hotel for our sons wedding and had a wonderful experience. The front desk staff was very friendly and we appreciated their ability to accommodate some last minute requests from our guests. The room was perfect for our family of four. We had a family suite with a separate bedroom with a king bed. In the main room there was a queen bed and a pull out couch. Mauren the event coordinator accommodated all of our requests with a smile and went above and beyond to assist with all the last minute details. Everything about the reception was flawless. The wait staff was efficient and friendly. The staff in charge of setting up the reception hall went out of their way to make sure we had everything we needed. I can not say enough good things about the staff at this hotel. Thank you for making our weekend extra special.

Better than expected. We chose this hotel because of this location. Close to the highway but you ca n’t hear traffic at all. Friendly welcoming lobby with a fireplace comfy chairs and a pool table. All rooms are suites and the door is thick enough that you can not hear the tv from the living room if in the bedroom. A good nights sleep as the room is dark and quiet and the bed is comfy. You can get internet tv so stream your favorite Netflix programming. Exercise room good size with various exercise equipment. A very attractive inside inner courtyard with live trees. All rooms look out onto the inner courtyard and elevators are glass for a view during the ride. Meant for business travelers as I wanted a cup of coffee at 10 am and the restaurant area not open from 10 am4 pm but there is a cofemaker in the room. I will stay at this chain again in other cities if the opportunity arises.
By far the best hotel we have been friendly staff nice gym great hotel. We will be back.
This facility was very well appointed with great rooms and rates.

Great Staff and comfortable stay. I was in town for 10 days for work training and everything went smoothly. Rooms were clean nice gym and pool. Restaurant is pretty good. Though the breakfast eggs could be better no major complaints. The staff was great and helpful in every way.

Absolutely gorgeous. It ’s a remodeled Embassy Suites so it has the huge indoor atrium. It ’s changing to a Mariot Renaissance in January. Loved it. Warm pool water. Friendly workers especially at breakfast. We were visiting the temple for the Church of Jesus Christ of Latter day Saints which is very close. Plenty of food nearby. Very clean. We will be back.
